website_summaries.verdict: Trail seekers looking to own a pair of Oboz kicks that are immensely comfortable are likely to have their expectations met in the Sawtooth II Low. Outdoorsy folks also had better prepare to be smitten by its amazing support system, quick break-in period, and remarkably spacious toe box. That said, this mesmerizingly good-looking hiker might disappoint those who value fit precision in their gear or those who look forward to a footbed that needs no replacing. Overall, while the Oboz Sawtooth II Low’s portfolio contains some misses, it does list qualities that can make hikes safe and enjoyable right from the get-go.
pros: Several wearers couldn’t contain their admiration for the Oboz Sawtooth II Low’s astonishing level of comfort
Its overall supportiveness made a strong impression on a female patron
The roominess of its forefoot space resonated well with a hiking enthusiast
Someone who tested this shoe was able to break it in without too much effort
An owner found the Oboz Sawtooth II Low (women’s) quite the stylish footwear
cons: This day hiking shoe was considered a letdown by a consumer for having a lackluster footbed
A couple of wearers experienced blistering

customer_reviews.title: I’m not exaggerating, these shoes cured my planter fasciitis!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. Bought them and wear them around the house for a couple of days and then went on a 10 mile hike into the Cascades. My feet felt great. I’m not exaggerating, these shoes cured my planter fasciitis! If you have plantar fasciitis, I highly recommend these shoes and get a size 1/2 a size larger than what you normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Doink

customer_reviews.title: Fit and feel are superb, and no need to buy an insert.
customer_reviews.text: The fit and feel of these shoes are outstanding. Best thing - the insole insert is of great quality. I did not need to add an aftermarket insole at another $50 or so (I’ve used Sole brand). Oboz makes their inserts almost as sturdy as the aftermarket ones. I have worn Merrell shoes for a decade, with some variation in the fit and wear quality with each new pair. These Oboz shoes fit better and have a more cushioned feel as you step forward. They seem to ventilate as well as the Merrells. I look forward to trying some Oboz ankle high models.
customer_reviews.author: Alan A. Mapes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, quality hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I have a weak arch in my foot and these Oboz Sawtooth’s have a very aggressive arch which I love. The added bonus is when your shoes wear out, you can remove the insoles and put them in a different shoe. I have never gone hiking with them yet, but the traction is very aggressive. Would be an awesome shoe for it.
customer_reviews.author: jet blast

customer_reviews.title: Excellent footwear, highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn them on some hikes, not broken in yet, but when they are, I know they will be completely more comfortable than what they currently are right now. I had no problem hiking 3 miles in rocky terrain with these, handled great, feet were not sore but they did get a little hot and sweaty (that might’ve been because of the socks I was wearing) but other than that this is an excellent excellent shoe. I’m expecting to get long use out of these and when these wear out, I’ll be buying another pair. I think they’re a little on the expensive side, But are well worth it! You can’t put a price on happy feet!
customer_reviews.author: S. WhatUmacallit

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love but slid down to a one star
customer_reviews.text: ***Update Sept 2020: I use this shoe for yardwork now and occasional long walks. Still slippery on mildly wet surface but is comfortable. I would not use for hiking or even casual wear but for yard work it does fine. I love the Oboz brand, usually. This shoes do not breathe. The sole slips on even mildly wet surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good shoe
customer_reviews.text: First pair had a distinct bulge under the ball of the right foot. Uncomfortable. Second pair is better. I think it may be the location of the metatarsal pad. May replace the insole. Update: Replaced the insole. Much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: tonermd

customer_reviews.title: No break-in period, fantastic shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love these for hiking. The whole family wears them. Good if you have wider feet like us. Waterproof ones can be hot in summer but regular sawtooth II is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny H

customer_reviews.title: really great hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have recently started doing some some pretty steep trails. I found myself slipping a lot going up and coming down. I started looking around for a shoe with more lugs (like my old Patagonia Drifters that they don't make anymore). I saw the Oboz and decided to try a pair. I just got back from a week of hiking around Leadville, CO. I really like these shoes. they did really well on some steep and gravely trails. They fit well and are very comfortable. The way the lugs stick out on the sole give a lot support on uneven ground. And the sole is fairly stiff, so you don't feel every rock.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Lemasters

customer_reviews.title: Love'em
customer_reviews.text: I've had several pairs of Merrill and Keens in this style. These are much more comfortable! I got the wide version and they are the best fitting shoes I've had in a long time. Treads are great for mountain bike peddles too!
customer_reviews.author: CDB

customer_reviews.title: True to size, go wider
customer_reviews.text: These run as traditional hiking boot sizes. Going to a wide would be more comfortable is you’re wearing these for work as narrower sides are meant to keep your foot from rolling. Otherwise, thin socks and loosening up the laces on the tongue, they’re fine
customer_reviews.author: bgrn583

customer_reviews.title: Fit well but stiff and hot
customer_reviews.text: If I was climbing a remote, icy mountain and encountering all kinds of sharp rocks, like one of those hip skinny dudes in the Patagonia catalog, I'd love these shoes. They fit well (my feet are 11.5 and narrow) and provide a lot of support. They feel very solid. But they're also stiff and hot! Let's face it, most of us, including me, do serious hiking about as often as we get a colonoscopy. We wear hiking shoes around town, because we like the look. For me, these seem comfortable and well made, but too stiff and hot.
customer_reviews.author: Cadillac Buddha

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes. Also one of the few manufacturers that have my size. I've worn these for a few months now and they are very comfortable and durable. Definitely worth my money
customer_reviews.author: Ike Green

customer_reviews.title: Toe box to narrow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my hubby. He says the toe box still isn't wide enough. I returned these and ordered him a pair of Altras. The womens Sawtooth II has a noticeably wider toe box than the original (and I love them!). I'm not sure why the mens didn't seem any wider. He was really disappointed that these didn't work for him.
customer_reviews.author: Manda

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: I put many miles on my feet every day taking care of landscape responsibilities, and I haven't found a better shoe to do it in...
customer_reviews.author: John Wilkirson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Did a 40 mile hike with them straight out of the box with a 40 lb pack. No issues in the beginning stage at least. Comfortable fit. Appears to be well made. My guess is that they will last and make it to my top 5!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Sansing

customer_reviews.title: If you have low volume feet, try these
customer_reviews.text: Oboz is about the only brand that fits my foot - high arch but very low volume. Was looking for a walking shoe and tried many, then remembered that my Oboz boots actually fit. Based on that I tried these and they work.
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: Rugged comfortable trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm very happy with them. They're rugged, comfortable and not too heavy. I haven't put them through any rigorous trekking but they certainly will hold up to my travels; urban setting, public parks and trails. Previous reviews indicate that these are somewhat on the wide side. I don't find that to be true for me. I've never worn a wide shoe and these fit well with a medium weight sock.
customer_reviews.author: bpdgun

customer_reviews.title: great for arch issues
customer_reviews.text: First pair of shoes I did not put an aftermarket orthotic into. I have bad plantar fasciitis and these are the best shoes I have ever worn for this issue. Size is regular, not too big or small
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Super Hard and Not Flexible
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very different than the original Sawtooth. They may work for walking on sharp rocks, but not for much else. It's like walking in a tank. Very hard sole. It hurt my feet to walk in them more than 20 minutes. Plus the top is a cheap synthetic. I wore them at my campfire and an ember burnt a hole in the top!
customer_reviews.author: G Rogowitz

customer_reviews.title: Extremely  Disappointed !
customer_reviews.text: these shoes are not nearly as durable as advertised. I bought them based upon product reviews of them being worn everyday and lasting more than a year. I have bought two pair of these, I alternate them from day to day and at the current wear rate I will have to replace them in about a month. Just not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, worth the money, just watch the sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Sizes run about 1/2 size small. I wear a size 11, but this shoe fit my feet as 10 1/2. They are not water proof, and are nicely ventilated. The sole is very rugged and built for rough terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable Hikers
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something (I hope) will last. These shoes seem well made and feel great, they hug your feet in all the right places. I had a pair of Merrell's that I liked very much, had them for maybe 3 years, and wasn't wearing them every day or year around, but the soles wore out at the heal. So I wanted something more rugged.......I think these are going to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking and walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have issues with my leg and knee to begin with. The Oboz shoe helps me walk better and actually feels like it supports my knee. I would recommend these to everyone who hikes and walks.
customer_reviews.author: CES

customer_reviews.title: Last longer than keens.
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, I have gone through 2 pairs and they are worth every cent. They last much longer than keens and apparently they plant a tree with every pair sold, five stars.
customer_reviews.author: zack

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and he loves them. We live in rugged country in the mountains and he loves how stable they are, how comfortable they are and how flexible they are. Dirt roads and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Berry

customer_reviews.title: Fits like no other
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple sets of walking shoes that scaled trails from the Tetons in Wyoming to the Great Western Way ion Scotland. Oboz has been my hands down choice due to comfort, fit and durability. My new pair arrived, out of the box they have been on my feet for a week with no problems whatsoever. Happy client.
customer_reviews.author: R. V. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Hiking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear Keens for years, but got tired of the sole wearing wearing out so fast. So, I bought a pair of Merrill’s Moab 2 boots for the winter. They are real nice but my foot is on the narrow side of medium and the Moab’s are on the wide side of medium. These Oboz are a perfect fit for me. Very comfortable with good support for my somewhat flat feet. I will buy another pair if the soles hold up better than keen’s. If not then Moab with Vibram soles will be in my future.
customer_reviews.author: Muthman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let their price fool you! Great hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! I’ve had experience with this brand and though they might feel a little tight at first, they break in quickly and conform to my feet. They are very easy to walk in, are very supportive and they grip super well. Best hiking shoe I’ve had in a long time and less expensive than other brands!
customer_reviews.author: David Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Of reasonably good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing danner boots as of late. These are a great deal stiffer. Not a lot of miles yet so we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: tonermd

customer_reviews.title: OBOX Sawtooth II hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Oboz shoe fits well but my foot didn’t like the plastic insole that they rave about. I purchased a gel insert and my foot lives it. Shoe looks wonderful. Wearing well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ozgard

customer_reviews.title: No response from seller.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes arrived in good order, however after a little more then a month of wear the rubber toe is starting to separate. Emailed seller with no response. At this price point I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Van A Braatz

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoes at a fair price!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes and this company. They are comfortable, durable and when I had an issue with a pair a couple years ago, they sent me a new pair!
customer_reviews.author: Chad E. Finn

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable shoes for hiking or everyday use. Much more durable than a comparable shoe from Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Super J

customer_reviews.title: Heel lining
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes for work and hiking. Love Oboz shoes and this is my second pair. This pair however, seems to have a flaw in the heel lining. After only 3 months the inside lining is completely shredded exposing bare plastic against my heel. The previous pair lasted 3 years without this happening. Update: Great company!! They replaced the shoes promptly!
customer_reviews.author: Omer

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so shallow that they almost fit like Crocks... Returned the following day without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alden

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Great comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable hiking shoe I’ve owned. So comfortable I bought two pair to ensure I had another for when they inevitably discontinue them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shows bc he has a narrow foot and hard to find comfortable shoes that he can wear all day.
customer_reviews.author: Tunxistwins

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, light and breathable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a light summer work shoe, tried keen with no luck. Too heavy and hot and no support. But these oboz are perfect! Good support for a low shoe and comfy out the box! Have only been wearing a week so not sure how they hold up yet but will update if I have any issues, would recommend. Also would go half size up.
customer_reviews.author: Jadon Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Irregular and too small
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several pair that I liked ... these were same size but too small
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Nice hiking shoe, a bit small and narrow, (even the wide version)
customer_reviews.text: Nice hiking shoe, a bit small and narrow, (even the wide version)
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. I bought these for my stepson who has autism and is very hard on shoes. This will be his second pair. I bought his first pair a year and a half ago and they still have a lot of life left in them. It was just time for a nice fresh pair.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit perfect (true to size 10.5) and by far the most comfortable shoes I've worn for work. I do a lot of walking and climbing stairs all day long. I have arthritis in my left knee and these shoes have helped minimize the aches and pains of my physical job.
customer_reviews.author: dkcx80

customer_reviews.title: great hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for walking or hiking. Made my knees feel better the more I used them.
customer_reviews.author: CES

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: The second time I have purchased these shoes. I enjoy using them as my everyday shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sean-Robert Clark

customer_reviews.title: Quality Outdoor Shoes that last
customer_reviews.text: Great all around outdoor activities shoe. This is my second pair and still live them + Oboz plants a tree for every pair of shoes purchase. 3 trees now and still think it is a cool company policy.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Crompton

customer_reviews.title: Love the heel cup
customer_reviews.text: the fit is great, my feet are comfortable on daily hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Forest Lakes Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe, solid construction, true to size. Tread pattern is aggressive and takes a little getting used to but works well on a rough trail.
customer_reviews.author: Marlowe Taylor

customer_reviews.title: My always reliable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these Sawtooth for years. This is my 3rd pair. I work in them all day and I wear them to the gym. I get over 2 years on these without changing the sole. I might buy a new soles next time to see if that prolongs life a bit. Helps with my planner fasciitis too.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cool and good fit.
customer_reviews.text: These were comfortable right out of the box. I need a roomy toe box and these deliver. Perfect fit. Nice ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Raymondo

customer_reviews.title: Fit and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe and I do a lot of walking.
customer_reviews.author: cha r

customer_reviews.title: Really a great shoe but size may run a little narrow
customer_reviews.text: Loved most aspects of this shoe. Would have given 5 stars but the fit is a little narrower than expected. I ordered a wide (W) but still tight at the Front. Getting more comfortable with wear so refrained from ordering the next larger width.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoe , very comfortable . Only issue was that the size was tight . Would suggest ordering 1 size up if they don’t have your size in a wide width .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gardener approved
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. I like them enough to keep going back. As the saying goes. If it ain’t broke don’t fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Jarid York

customer_reviews.title: Go a half size up!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these for years, this latest production run was tight, I had to go a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: usalienhunter

customer_reviews.title: shoes fit
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 14 hence can never find my shoes in stores these shoes fit like custom made. not all brands are true to size some companies don't use standard measurements I guess. Thank You OBOZ!!!
customer_reviews.author: dave white

customer_reviews.title: did not fit my size 14 foot with a low arch
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design and construction of this shoe, however the arch was too high and too far back for me. It was not comfortable so I returned it. Return was trouble free and refund prompt.
customer_reviews.author: KPE

customer_reviews.title: Fits great after breaking in
customer_reviews.text: Originally I felt the toe box was too small, but after a couple of weeks the shoes fit wonderfully. The sole gives great support, and prevents rocks from being felt.
customer_reviews.author: jeff bricker

customer_reviews.title: Sawtooth II does not fit like the original Sawtooth
customer_reviews.text: The Sawtooth II is very narrow compared to the previous original Sawtooth shoes I purchase and enjoyed. I returned them as they were unwearable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Perry

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. Very comfortable, fit perfectly and I will buy another pair again. Oboz makes a great product
customer_reviews.author: frank cooper

customer_reviews.title: Well cushioned
customer_reviews.text: second pair--obviously I like them. Easier on my feet than the LOWA I usually buy.
customer_reviews.author: Stew E

customer_reviews.title: These feel great and come in a wide size love the room in the toe box area.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit & Traction really feel good ..Can't wait to hit the trail..
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Best fit, most comfortable shoe I’ve ever purchased on line. Went hiking in Az saw people slipping and sliding. Not me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why wont amazon just send me return label?
customer_reviews.text: Product was fine.Wrong size is all.Problem is i want label to send on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Wide is not Wide
customer_reviews.text: Claims as fit as expected. Ordered a wide and it feels like it is smaller than Normal.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Mayberry

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes right out of the box. Well built and nice looking shoes
customer_reviews.author: John Tangeman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for hiking, so comfortable I don't want to take them off!
customer_reviews.author: mjc

customer_reviews.title: Oh boy, Obiz
customer_reviews.text: Live these shoes. Light-weight for me. Excellent walking and day hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott MacIver

product_meta.title: Oboz unisex-adult mens Sawtooth Ii Low
product_meta.description: The MVP of your most trail-worthy quiver, the Sawtooth II brings another level of streamlined functionality to the trail with breathable mesh paneling, a lighter weight but sturdy heel counter, and an asymmetrical collar for improved fit around the ankle.
feature_bullets: O FIT Insole: Our proprietary insole is what we're known for. Molded to match the specific shape and construction of every pair we make, this purpose-designed technology delivers the kind of fit, feel and performance that's unmatched in the industry.

UPPER: Waterproof nubuck leather & highly abrasion-resistant textile provide durability and protection while letting feet breath. Asymmetrical collar designed to comfortably articulate with your ankle. A molded rubber heel counter helps maintain a snug, Comfort heel hold over time.

SAWTOOTH MIDSOLE: Great for the everyday, whether it's on the AT or your local trail. Featuring a dual-density EVA midsole that provides cushioning and stability, and a nylon shank that gives added support under foot.

SAWTOOTH OUTSOLE: A thru-hiker cult favorite and classic Oboz outsole, built to be versatile, flexible and supportive. The map molded in the bottom of the outsole features the Sawtooth mountain range near Sun Valley, Idaho.
We plant a tree for every pair of Oboz sold.

specifications.Usage: Walking, Backpacking, Outdoor, Breathable Multi-Sport, Hiking
